author: Sefy Levy
description: Compare terrestrial basalts to Martian, lunar, or meteoritic analogs using Fe/Mn fingerprint
reference: Papike et al., 2003; planetary basalt fingerprinting

classifications.name: MARTIAN ANALOG (Fe/Mn 35-45)
classifications.description: Mars-like Fe/Mn ratio - SNC meteorite signature
classifications.notes: Martian mantle signature - screening for Mars analog studies

classifications.name: TERRESTRIAL (Fe/Mn 50-70)
classifications.description: Earth-like Fe/Mn ratio - typical terrestrial basalt
classifications.notes: Terrestrial mantle signature - normal Earth basalts

classifications.name: LUNAR ANALOG (Fe/Mn 70-90)
classifications.description: Moon-like Fe/Mn ratio - lunar basalt signature
classifications.notes: Lunar mantle signature - screening for Moon analog studies

classifications.name: ANOMALOUS / OUT OF RANGE
classifications.description: Fe/Mn ratio outside known planetary ranges
classifications.notes: Unusual Fe/Mn - check for alteration or analytical error

classifications.name: ANOMALOUS / OUT OF RANGE
classifications.description: Fe/Mn ratio outside known planetary ranges
classifications.notes: Unusual Fe/Mn - check for alteration or analytical error

classifications.name: INSUFFICIENT DATA
classifications.notes: Requires Fe and Mn measurements for planetary analog comparison

notes: Fe/Mn ratio is relatively constant within a planetary mantle source. Earth ‚âà 60, Mars (SNC meteorites) ‚âà 40, Moon ‚âà 80. This is a screening-level tool for planetary analog studies. Terrestrial basalts with Martian-like Fe/Mn can serve as field analogs for Mars mission planning.
